enumDescriptions: RRM: tumour reaches the relevant margin in the excision
NRM: tumour does not reach the relevant margin in the excision
null: no mention about the tumour reaching the relevant margins in the excision and neither 'RRM' nor 'NRM' is applicable.

ER_Status.description: ER Receptor Status as indicated in report
enumDescriptions: P: ER status is positive
N: ER status is negative
NP: if the ER status test is explicitly specified as Not Performed in the report
null: ER status is not specified in the report or if the report mentions that the ER test is not applicable (N/A) to the patient.

ER_Type.description: ER Scoring system used to score estrogen receptor (ER) tumour immunohistochemistry stains)
enumDescriptions: QS: reporting an Allred score or a quick score (QS) for ER status. Its value ranges from 0-8
IP: reporting a H-score or a combined score obtained by multiplying the intensity of staining and the percentage of positive cells for ER status. Its value ranges from 0-300
MD: reporting the Mitch Dowsett score for ER status. Its value ranges from 0-18
I: intensity of staining for ER status and does not mention any derived scores (i.e. quick/Allred score, H-score/combined score, Mitch Dowsett score). This case is unusual. Its value ranges from 0-3

P: percentage of positive cells for ER status and does not mention any derived scores (i.e. quick/Allred score, H-score/combined score, Mitch Dowsett score). This case is unusual. Its value ranges from 0-100%
null: if the report does not mention any of the ER score types

PR_Status.description: PR Receptor Status as indicated in report
enumDescriptions: P: ER status is positive
N: ER status is negative
NP: if the ER status test is explicitly specified as Not Performed in the report
null: ER status is not specified in the report or if the report mentions that the ER test is not applicable (N/A) to the patient.

Pr_Type.description: PR Scoring system used to score estrogen receptor (PR) tumour immunohistochemistry stains)
enumDescriptions: QS: reporting an Allred score or a quick score (QS) for PR status. Its value ranges from 0-8
IP: reporting a H-score or a combined score obtained by multiplying the intensity of staining and the percentage of positive cells for PR status. Its value ranges from 0-300
MD: reporting the Mitch Dowsett score for PR status. Its value ranges from 0-18
I: intensity of staining for PR status and does not mention any derived scores (i.e. quick/Allred score, H-score/combined score, Mitch Dowsett score). This case is unusual. Its value ranges from 0-3

P: percentage of positive cells for PR status and does not mention any derived scores (i.e. quick/Allred score, H-score/combined score, Mitch Dowsett score). This case is unusual. Its value ranges from 0-100%
null: if the report does not mention any of the PR score types

HER2_Status.description: HER2 Receptor Status as indicated in report
enumDescriptions: N: if the HER2 status is specified as Negative in the report.
B: if the HER2 status is specified as Borderline in the report.
P: if the HER2 status is specified as Positive in the report.
NP: if the HER2 status test is explicitly specified as Not Performed in the report
null: if the HER2 status is not specified in the report or if the report mentions that the HER2 test is not applicable (N/A) to the patient.

HER2_Score.description: HER2 ImmunoHistoChemistry Score as reported. There are combinations of these scores eg. 2/3+
enumDescriptions: 0: Negative
1+: Negative
2+: Borderline
3+: Positive
null: Missing information or not applicable

HER2_FISH.description: Fluorescence in situ hybridisation test for HER2 as reported
enumDescriptions: A: if the HER2 FISH/ISH test result/significance is described as Amplified in the report.
N: if the HER2 FISH/ISH test result/significance is described as Non-Amplified in the report.
POS: if the HER2 FISH/ISH test result/significance is described as Positive in the report.
NEG: if the HER2 FISH/ISH test result/significance is described as Negative or Normal in the report.
NP: if the HER2 FISH/ISH test is explicitly specified as Not Performed in the report

null: if the HER2 FISH/ISH test result is not present in the report, if the FISH/ISH test is requested but no FISH/ISH test results are present in this report, and if the report mentions that the FISH/ISH test is not applicable (N/A) to the patient.

Ki67.description: Ki67 % Positive nuclei as indicated in report

ICDMorphologyCode.description: Intl Classification of Diseases Morphology Code (ICD_O) when indicated in report. Missing information or not applicable is coded as Null

enumDescriptions: N: Not Malignant
X: Not breast primary
U: Not Known
B: Borderline
Y: Yes Malignant

BrCa1.description: BrCa 1 gene present when indicated in report

BrCa2.description: BrCa 2 gene present when indicated in report

MitoticActivity.description: Presence of proliferating cells for assessing Grade

Side.description: The laterality of the breast from which the main tissue specimen was collected
enumDescriptions: L: if the specimen was collected from the left breast.
R: if the specimen was collected from the right breast.
U: Unknown laterality

TumourCount.description: Tumour identifier coded sequentially from 1 to max number of tumours per pathology report. Dataset has one row per tumour

ReportDat.description: Date of Report. Missing information is null (blank)

CoreDat.description: Date of Core Biopsy (if previously performed and indicated in the report or if the report is for a core biopsy - in this case ReportDat = CoreDat). Missing is coded null.

DateSpecimenTaken.description: Specimen taken date. Missing is coded as null (blank)

DateSpecimenReceived.description: Specimen received in hospital laboratory. Missing is coded as null (blank)

enumDescriptions: Y: if the report mentions that the tumour/abnormality was detected through cancer screening.
N: if the report explicitly mentions that the tumour/abnormality was not detected through cancer screening.
NK: Not known about the screen detection
null: missing or not applicable
WBB: if Wide Bore Needle Biopsy (also called Core Biopsy or Mammotome Biopsy) was performed.
WLE: if Wide Local Excision was performed.
M: if Mastectomy was performed.
NBO: if only Node Biopsy was performed.
OB: if Open Biopsy was performed.
Re-ex: if a re-excision (wide excision) was performed.
SE: if Segmental Excision was performed.
TMP: if Therapeutic Mammoplasty was performed.
FNA: if Fine Needle Aspiration was performed.
LB: if Local Biopsy was performed.
null: if this information is missing in the report or it cannot be determined from the information in the report.

SpecimenWeight.description: Weight of specimen (grams). Missing is coded as null (blank)

AxillaryProcedure.description: Axillary Procedure indicates the procedures performed during surgery to remove or sample axillary lymph nodes. If the same procedure for multiple tumours in a report, information is repeated for each tumour.
enumDescriptions: ANC: if Axillary Node Clearance was done.
ANS: if Axillary Node Sample was collected.
NLN: if the report explicitly mentions that no Lymph node procedure was done
OSNA: if One-Step Nucleic Acid Amplification (OSNA) assessment was performed.
SNB: if Sentinel Node Biopsy.
null: Missing or not applicable

PostNeoadjuvantChemo.description: Specimen taken after treatment (Chemotherapy or Endocrine)
enumDescriptions: C: if the report explicitly mentions that the patient received chemotherapy.
E: if the report explicitly mentions that the patient received endocrine therapy.
PC: Possible Chemotherapy
PE: Possible Endocrine therapy
null: if the report does not contain any information on neoadjuvant therapy status.

InsituCarcinoma.description: In situ  is present or not in the report
enumDescriptions: P: In situ Carcinoma is present
N: In situ Carcinoma not present
null: Missing or not applicable

DuctalCarcinomaInsitu.description: In situ Ductal Carcinoma is present or not in the report
enumDescriptions: P: In situ Ductal Carcinoma is present
N: In situ Ductal Carcinoma not present
null: Missing or not applicable

DCISGrade.description: DCIS grade mentioned in the report
enumDescriptions: L: if the report specifies a low grade DCIS.
IL: if the report specifies an intermediate and low grade DCIS.
I: if the report specifies an intermediate grade DCIS.
HI: if the report specifies a high and intermediate grade DCIS.
H: if the report specifies a high grade DCIS.
N: Not assessable
null: if the DCIS grade was not described in the report.

Solid_DCISGP.description: Solid DCIS growth pattern is described in the report or not
enumDescriptions: Y: Solid DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned in the report
null: No Solid DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned

Cribiform_DCISGP.description: Cribiform DCIS Growth pattern is mentioned or not in the report
enumDescriptions: Y: Cribiform DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned in the report
null: No Cribiform DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned

Micropapillary_DCISGP.description: Micropapillary DCIS Growth pattern is mentioned or not in the report
enumDescriptions: Y: Micropapillary DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned in the report
null: No Micropapillary DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned

Papillary_DCISGP.description: Papillary DCIS Growth pattern is mentioned or not in the report
enumDescriptions: Y: Papillary DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned in the report
null: No Papillary DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned

Apocrine_DCISGP.description: Apocrine DCIS Growth pattern is mentioned or not in the report
enumDescriptions: Y: Apocrine DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned in the report
null: No Apocrine DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned

Flat_DCISGP.description: Flat DCIS Growth pattern is mentioned or not in the report
enumDescriptions: Y: Flat DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned in the report
null: No Flat DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned

Comedo_DCISGP.description: Comedo DCIS Growth pattern is mentioned or not in the report
enumDescriptions: Y: Comedo DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned in the report
null: No Comedo DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned

Clinging_DCISGP.description: Clinging DCIS Growth pattern is mentioned or not in the report
enumDescriptions: Y: Clinging DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned in the report
null: No Clinging DCIS Growth Pattern mentioned
Y: if the report specifies that comedo necrosis is present in DCIS but the extent is not specified.
N: if the report explicitly specifies that comedo necrosis is not present in DCIS.
Mil: if the report specifies that comedo necrosis is present in DCIS and the extent is mild.
Mod: if the report specifies that comedo necrosis is present in DCIS and the extent is moderate.
Mar: if the report specifies that comedo necrosis is present in DCIS and the extent is marked.
null: if the report does not contain information on comedo necrosis in DCIS.

SizeDCISOnly.description: Size of in situ carcinoma only (mm). Missing information or not applicable is coded as null.

LobularCarcinomaInsitu.description: In situ Lobular Carcinoma is present or not in the report
enumDescriptions: Y: In situ Lobular Carcinoma is present
N: In situ Lobular Carcinoma not present
null: Missing or not applicable

PleomorphicLCIS.description: Pleomorphic LCIS is present or not in the report
enumDescriptions: Y: Pleomorphic LCIS is present
N: Pleomorphic LCIS is not present
null: Missing or not applicable

PagetsDisease.description: Paget's Disease is present or not in the report
enumDescriptions: Y: Paget's Disease of the breast is present
N: Paget's Disease of the breast is not present
null: Missing or not applicable

Microinvasion.description: Invasive carcinoma of the breast with no invasive focus measuring more than 1 mm
enumDescriptions: P: Microinvasive breast cancer is present
N: Microinvasive breast cancer is not present
null: Missing or not applicable

InvasiveCarcinoma.description: Invasive carcinoma is present in the report or not
enumDescriptions: P: Invasive Carcinoma present
N: Invasive Carcinoma is not present
null: Missing or not applicable

SizeInvasiveTumour.description: Largest dimension of dominant invasive tumour (mm). Missing information or not applicable is coded null.

SizeWholeTumour.description: Invasive plus surrounding DCIS if DCIS extends >1mm (mm). Missing information or not applicable is coded null.

enumDescriptions: NST: if the invasive carcinoma type is specified as of 'No Special Type' (NST). When there is no mixed tumour component, invasive/infiltrating ductal carcinoma (IDC) implies No Special Type.

PST: if the invasive carcinoma type is specified as of 'Pure Special Type'. When there is no mixed tumour component and the tumour type is not described as type other, a single invasive component such as— only invasive lobular carcinoma (ILC), only invasive tubular carcinoma, only invasive cribriform carcinoma, only invasive mucinous carcinoma, only papillary carcinoma, only medullary breast cancer, etc.— each imply that the invasive carcinoma is of Pure Special Type.
MTT: if the invasive carcinoma type is specified as of 'Mixed' type, and the mixed components were specifically ductal (NST) and lobular.

MIX: if the invasive carcinoma type is specified as of 'Mixed' type, and the mixed components were anything other than the pair— ductal (NST) and lobular. For example, mixed ductal and mucinous, mixed ductal and tubular, mixed lobular and cribriform, etc.
OTH: if the invasive carcinoma type is specified as of 'Other' type.
null: if the invasive carcinoma type is not specified in the report.
Lob': if the invasive carcinoma type is specified as 'Pure Special Type' and the component type is specified as 'Lobular'.
Pap': if the invasive carcinoma type is specified as 'Pure Special Type' and the component type is specified as 'Papillary'.
Tub': if the invasive carcinoma type is specified as 'Pure Special Type' and the component type is specified as 'Tubular'.
Crb': if the invasive carcinoma type is specified as 'Pure Special Type' and the component type is specified as 'Cribriform'.
Muc': if the invasive carcinoma type is specified as 'Pure Special Type' and the component type is specified as 'Mucinous'.
Med': if the invasive carcinoma type is specified as 'Pure Special Type' and the component type is specified as 'Medullary'.
T/C: Tubular/Cribiform (mixed tumour with tubular and cribiform components. Type = MIX)
Oth: Other
D/L: Ductal/Lobular (mixed tumour with ductal and lobular components. Type = MTT)
Tul: Tubulobular (mixed tumour with tubular and lobular components. Type = MIX)

null: if the invasive carcinoma type is not specified as of 'Pure Special Type' in the report (and so variable 'invasiveCarcinomaType' is not 'PST') or the component type is not specified in the report.
1: Grade 1 or well differentiated
2: Grade 2 or moderately differentiated
3: Grade 3 or poorly differentiated
NA: Not assessable
null: Missing or not applicable

Tubules.description: Percentage of cells in the tumour that have tube shaped structures for assessing Grade

Pleomorphism.description: Variability in size and shape for assessing Grade

enumDescriptions: LOC: if the tumour extent is explicitly described as 'Localised' in the report.
MIF: if the tumour extent is explicitly described as 'Multifocal' (or Multiple foci, Multi invasive foci, etc.) in the report.
UNI: if the tumour extent is explicitly described as 'Unifocal' in the report
null: if the tumour extent is not explicitly specified in the report.

VascularInvasion.description: Presence of Tumour cells within the lumen of blood and / or lymph vessel
enumDescriptions: Pres: if the pathologist has reported that lymphatic or vascular invasion is present.
Poss: if the pathologist has reported that lymphatic or vascular invasion is possible or probable.
NS: if the pathologist has reported that lymphatic or vascular invasion is not seen.
null: if the pathologist has not reported on the status of lymphatic or vascular invasion.
Y: if the report clearly indicates that axillary lymph nodes are present/sampled for analysis.

N: if the report explicitly specifies that axillary lymph nodes are not present/sampled for analysis. Note 1: If the total number of axillary nodes is specified as 0, assign 'N'. Note 2: If only nodes of type 'other' are mentioned in the report, assign 'N'.
null: if the report does not contain this information.

AxillaryNodesTotal.description: Total number of axillary nodes. Missing information or not applicable

AxillaryNodesPositive.description: Total number of positive axillary nodes. Missing information or not applicable

enumDescriptions: Y: if the report clearly indicates that lymph nodes of type 'other' are present/sampled
N: if the report clearly indicates that lymph nodes of type 'other' are not present/sampled
null: if the report does not contain this information.

OtherNodesTotal.description: Total of nodes other than axillary. Missing information or not applicable is coded as Null

OtherNodesPositive.description: Total number of nodes other than axillary that are positive. Missing information or not applicable is coded as Null

Tstage.description: Tumour staging for extent (size) of the primary tumour - taken as reported, could follow different editions of American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) guidance | AJCC TMA staging system. Prefix c= clinical stage, p = pathological or surgical stage, yp = post therapy pathological stage, yc post therapy clinical stage. Suffix mic = microinvasive

NStage.description: Lymph Node staging | AJCC TMA staging system. Prefix c = clinical stage, p = pathological or surgical stage. Suffix sn = Sentinel lymph node metastasis, ONSA = One step nucleic acid amplification

Mstage.description: Metastasis staging describes whether cancer has spread to a different part of the body | Prefix c = Clinical assessment data (examination, imaging , endoscopy), p = pathological data (histopathologic examination of tissue sample)
